N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 451.1 - Accelerated depreciation

State Regulations

Method of depreciation which generates a greater amount
of expense in the earlier life of an asset, and less expense in the later
years, than the straight-line method. The purposes for adopting such a method
would be: (a) operation of plant or
equipment at more than normal speed, use or capacity; (b) a useful or economic life materially less
than physical life; (c) an
excessive cost being written off during what is estimated to be the high-price
period; and
(d) tax advantages
arising from the use of declining-balance and sum-of-the-years
methods. Notes
